business.headline: Explained: Why the IMF is under fire for $1 billion loan to PakistanThe disbursement, approved on Friday under the Extended Fund Facility (EFF), raises total payouts under the programme to $2.1 billion. But the timing of the announcement has provoked a fierce backlash.

India–Pakistan tensions escalate. What's next for Dalal Street investors?While the Sensex and Nifty ended over 1% lower in the previous session, experts suggest that the decline was far less than what could have been expected in such a volatile environment.

Nirmala Sitharama asks banks to stay on alert amid rising Indo-Pak tensionsThe directive comes a day after India successfully intercepted multiple missile and drone attacks launched from Pakistan late on May 8. While India reported no major damage, the government has since asked all critical institutions to bolster their cybersecurity infrastructure in anticipation of potential retaliatory attacks.
'Unsupportive stance towards India': Go Homestays ends ties with Turkish AirlinesGo Homestays ends ties with Turkish Airlines after Turkey backs Pakistan following 'Operation Sindoor'.

India-Pak tensions: Oil PSUs assure ample fuel stocks, urge against panic buyingIndian oil companies have issued statements assuring ample fuel stocks across the country. The Indian Oil Corporation and Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited have emphasised that there is no shortage of petrol, diesel, CNG, or LPG.

Bharti Airtel in talks to acquire 49% stake in Haier India: ReportSunil Mittal, the billionaire-founder of Indian telecom operator Bharti Airtel, has partnered with private equity firm, Warburg Pincus to buy a substantial stake in Haier India.

Telecom regulator recommends 5-year satellite spectrum allotment: ReportThe move comes amid growing interest in satellite internet services from global players like Elon Musk's Starlink and domestic telecom giants.
Sensex closes 880 points lower, Nifty above 24,000; Titan ends 4% upThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 880.34 points to end at 79,454.47, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 265.80 points to close at 24,008.00.

Essential goods supply to remain unaffected across India amid geopolitical heatPrices of key food items, including pulses and vegetables, are being watched closely to make sure they stay under control. Efforts are also being made to keep the supply of these items steady across all cities.

Planning an FD in 2025? Check these 6 banks offering attractive interest ratesFor fixed deposits between 15 and 21 months, HDFC Bank is offering 7.05% to general citizens, while senior citizens get 7.55%

Finance Minister to review cyber readiness of banks, financial institutionsThe meeting will bring together representatives from several key institutions like the Reserve Bank of India (RBI), the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI), the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), the National Stock Exchange (NSE), etc.
Explained: Why Yes Bank share price jumped over 7% todayThe Yes Bank stock has now gained nearly 11% over the past five sessions, sparking investor curiosity.

entertainment.headline: Actor Ravi Mohan, rumoured partner Kenishaa attend reception amid heavy trollingActor Ravi Mohan and his rumoured partner Kenishaa made yet another public appearance at producer Ishari Ganesh's daughter's wedding reception in Chennai. This comes a day after the two was trolled for their appearance amid Ravi's divorce battle with wife Aarti.

Samantha recalls 'shaking' on Oo Antava sets: Who thinks of me for a special song?Samantha reminisced about dancing in front of '500 junior artistes' on the sets of the 'Oo Antava' song in 'Pushpa'. She said she took it as an opportunity and did it even when she was 'shaking' out of nervousness.

Taylor Swift's team blasts Justin Baldoni over subpoena in Blake Lively caseThe representatives of Taylor Swift's team talked to the media and criticised actor Justin Baldoni for involving her in his lawsuit against Blake Lively. The team called this a 'tabloid clickbait move'.

Did Salman Khan make a post on India-Pakistan ceasefire and later delete it?Several screenshots of Salman Khan's X-post about the India-Pakistan ceasefire are going viral on social media. It seems like the Bollywood superstar posted about the ceasefire on Saturday and deleted it later.

Big B breaks silence on Operation Sindoor after series of blank posts on XAmitabh Bachchan made a long, emotional, and empowering note about Operation Sindoor, mentioning the woman who lost her husband, asked a terrorist to kill her as well. The actor shared his father's poetry in the post. His post comes almost 20 days after the Pahalgam terrorist attack.

No Bhool Chuk Maaf's release till next hearing on June 16: Bombay courtPVR sued Maddock Films, the production house, for cancelling the release of 'Bhool Chuk Maaf' citing Indo-Pak conflict. Now, Bombay High Court has restrained the film's release till the next hearing, which will take place on June 16.

Actor Nimrat Kaur on Indo-Pak conflict: Terrorism has no placeActor Nimrat Kaur shared her personal journey as a martyr's daughter and highlighted the urgent need to address terrorism's root causes for lasting peace. She appealed to citizens to stay calm and support the armed forces amid Indo-Pak tensions.

Op Sindoor: Aamir Khan wants assurance of no attacks in future, Saif salutes armyAamir Khan, at a recent event, spoke about the Pahalgam attack and said that we, as a nation, would need assurance that such attacks will not happen again. Saif Ali Khan applauded the armed forces for their bravery and Operation Sindoor.

Telugu actor Nani reveals why he went ahead with HIT 3 event amid Indo-Pak tensionsTelugu actor Nani was called out for holding 'HIT 3' success event amid escalating Indo-Pak tensions. He stated that he didn't want to give terrorists the satisfaction of cancelling an event.

PVR sues Maddock Films after cancellation of Bhool Chuk Maaf theatrical releasePVR has sued Maddock Films for Rs 60 crore for the last-minute cancellation of the theatrical release of Bhool Chuk Maaf. Maddock Films is yet to release an official statement on the same.

Black, White and Gray: The uncomfortable fiction of this highly rated crime series'Black, White and Gray - Love Kills' is a gripping mockumentary series on SonyLIV that blurs the line between fiction and reality with its true-crime-style storytelling set in Nagpur. This six-episode show masterfully explores obsession and truth, leaving viewers questioning what is real in relationships and crime.

All about film on Operation Sindoor, makers' apology and clarificationFilmmaker Uttam Maheshwari deleted the poster of his film titled 'Operation Sindoor', and also apologised for hurting the sentiments of people, while India continues to defend its sovereignty amid escalating tensions between India and Pakistan.

Rhea Chakraborty's moving tribute to Indian army: From one fauji home to another...Actor Rhea Chakraborty wrote an emotional and empowering note as the 'daughter' of an Indian army officer. She sent her love to the families of the soldiers who are fighting for the country amid escalating tensions between India and Pakistan.

3 films, 3 different genres in Vijay Deverakonda's promising line-upActor Vijay Deverakonda announced his solid line-up of films on Friday. He shared the posters of the three films, indicating that the three belong to different genres.

When Nimrat Kaur recalled terrorists killing her father: Was kidnapped, terminatedActor Nimrat Kaur is the daughter of an army major who was martyred in 1994. In an interview, she once spoke about what she remembered from the day when she realised she had lost her father to terrorism.

Actors Khushbu, Radikaa Sarathukumar support Aarti over Ravi Mohan in divorce battleActors Khushbu Sundar and Radikaa Sarathkumar expressed their support for Aarti over actor Ravi Mohan in their divorce battle. This comes after Aarti's emotional yet strongly-worded statement following Ravi's latest public appearance with rumoured partner Kenishaa Francis.

Suits LA Season 2 cancelled after poor reviews: Report'Suits LA' Season 2 has been cancelled after the spin-off series received bad reviews and poor ratings upon its debut in February this year. The show has already premiered its 10 episodes.

Ram Charan receives warm welcome in London ahead of wax statue inauguration. PicsRam Charan's wax statue at Madame Tussauds London will be launched tomorrow. As he arrived in London, he received a loud cheers and warm welcome from his fans.

general news.headline: Op Sindoor still ongoing, briefing soon: Air Force after India-Pak ceasefireIndian Air Force says Operation Sindoor still ongoing after India-Pak ceasefire, briefing in due course

Vance had to call PM Modi, US role limited to getting India and Pak to talk: CNNAs per CNN, US Vice President JD Vance had to call Prime Minister Narendra Modi to inform him about a "high probability of dramatic escalation" over the weekend.

Pakistan admits to role in Pulwama terror attack amid Pahalgam heatPakistan military admitted to its involvement in the 2019 Pulwama attack, in which 40 CRPF personnel were killed, after years of denial. A top Pakistan Air Force officer publicly called the Pulwama attack "tactical brilliance". The rare admission, made on Friday, amid heat over India's "focused, measured and non-escalatory" Operation Sindoor, exposes the Islamabad-Rawalpindi regime's dirty terror secret.

Will work with India, Pak for solution to Kashmir issue: Trump after ceasefireUS President Donald Trump expressed his gratitude to the leaders of both countries, calling it a wise decision 'to stop the current aggression that could have led to the death and destruction of so many, and so much.'

All well in Pakistan, the land of confusion and coups?Minutes after Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif welcomed the ceasefire with India, without mentioning the word ceasefire, the Pakistani military started shelling and sending drones into Indian territory. Was General Asim Munir not agreeable to the ceasefire terms that the Sharif government must have agreed to? Is everything well within Pakistan, the land of confusion, contradictions and coups?

Uski fitrat hai...: Shashi Tharoor's 'sher' skewers Pak over ceasefire flipAfter Pakistan breached the ceasefire despite peace talks, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor took a veiled jibe at the same and wrote on X that it is "his nature to turn away".

Wise decision: P Chidambaram praises PM Modi for ceasefire deal with PakWriting in the aftermath of the Indian strikes on May 7 as part of 'Operation Sindoor', P Chidambaram noted that Prime Minister Narendra Modi had recognised the dangers of a wider war and had "wisely chosen a calibrated military response limited to selected targets".

Live: PM Modi in key security huddle with Rajnath Singh, CDS, military chiefsIndia-Pakistan Tension Live Updates: India accused Pakistan of ceasefire violation hours after foreign secretary Vikram Misri announced that India and Pakistan had reached an understanding to stop all firings and military actions on land, air and sea with immediate effect late on Saturday. However, the situation along the LoC is stable now while western border states are on high alert. PM Modi is currently having a security meeting with NSA Ajit Doval, Defence minister Rajnath Singh, CDS Anil Chauhan and military chiefs. India and Pakistan agreed to halt military actions hours after intense cross-border strikes. The escalation followed India's Operation Sindoor, launched in response to the April 22 Pahalgam terror attack that killed 26 people.

Big B breaks silence on Operation Sindoor after series of blank posts on XAmitabh Bachchan made a long, emotional, and empowering note about Operation Sindoor, mentioning the woman who lost her husband, asked a terrorist to kill her as well. The actor shared his father's poetry in the post. His post comes almost 20 days after the Pahalgam terrorist attack.

J&K on edge after Pak ceasefire breach; no firing, explosions overnightDespite Pakistan breaking the ceasefire deal within hours of it coming into effect, no firing or explosions were heard along the international borders through the night. However, Pakistani drones were spotted and blackouts were imposed in several areas.

Shehbaz Sharif calls ceasefire deal with India a 'victory' for PakistanWhile addressing the nation, Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif accused India of using the April 22 Pahlagam attack as an "excuse" to launch an attack on the nation.

Did Salman Khan make a post on India-Pakistan ceasefire and later delete it?Several screenshots of Salman Khan's X-post about the India-Pakistan ceasefire are going viral on social media. It seems like the Bollywood superstar posted about the ceasefire on Saturday and deleted it later.

How Commodore Nair completed tri-service circle, issued Pak stern warningCommodore Raghu R Nair busted Islamabad's lies in the Defence Ministry media briefing on India's ceasefire with Pakistan. The naval officer's presence with Colonel Sofia Qureshi and Wing Commander Vyomika Singh, who have briefed earlier, completed the tri-service presence which closely coordinated on Operation Sindoor. Here's more about Commodore Nair, who has exceptional service record.

India snatched defeat from jaws of victory: Brahma Chellaney on ceasefire with PakTop geostrategist Brahma Chellaney criticised India's decision to agree to a ceasefire with Pakistan, calling it a repeat of past strategic mistakes. He argued that India had the upper hand militarily but gave up its advantage without securing long-term gains.

England's 2027 World Cup qualification in danger after ODI rankings updateThe England cricket team are in danger of not earning direct qualification for the ODI World Cup 2027 as they slipped to the eighth position after the annual rankings update by the ICC.
Humiliated over 'fat' jibe, UP man chases friends 20 km, shoots themA man chased his friends and shot them after they made fun of his weight at a party in Gorakhpur.

Princess Gauravi Kumari on royal beauty secrets and what she loves about Gen ZIn an exclusive interview with India Today Digital, Princess Gauravi Kumari shares what she loves about being Gen Z, along with her skincare rituals and wellness routine.

Amazon India's Great Summer Sale 2025 is here: Transform your garden with upto 60% off on lawn & garden essentialsMake your Garden and Lawn summer ready with Amazon India's Great Summer Sale 2025 that is live now. Enjoy Up to 60% off on Lawn & Garden Essentials such as Plants, Solar Lights and more.

Janus-faced China condemns Pahalgam attack but backs 'friend' PakistanChina maintained a delicate diplomatic balance by reaffirming strong support for Pakistan and simultaneously condemning the Pahalgam terror attack in talks with India.

All shine, no spine: Why Indian football is built for business, not growthThe glitzy Indian Super League may shine on the surface, but beneath the fireworks and packed stadiums lies a deeper issue: a league built more for profit than for nurturing talent and creating a sustainable football ecosystem.

Before ceasefire came India's Israel-like shift in policy towards PakistanIndia and Pakistan agreed to a ceasefire after three days of military conflict across the border following India's Operation Sindoor strikes against terror infrastructure, which came in retaliation to the Pahalgam attack.

Soviet-era Cosmos-482 crashes over Indian Ocean after 53 years in spaceThe probe's return to Earth had been closely monitored by multiple space agencies, including the European Space Agency (ESA) and the European Union's Space Surveillance and Tracking network.

India-Pak ceasefire an understanding, not agreement: BJP reiterates Centre's standIndia has consistently referred to ceasefire deal with Pakistan as an "understanding" and has never officially termed it an agreement.

BCB pondering over Bangladesh's Pakistan tour amid security concernsThe Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) is still scratching its heads on the upcoming tour of Pakistan where the Tigers are set to participate in five T20Is from May 25 to June 3.

IPL 2025 likely to resume soon after India, Pakistan agree to ceasefireThe BCCI is set to decide the future of IPL 2025 following a ceasefire between India and Pakistan. This development could allow the tournament to resume nationwide after earlier disruptions.

Shubman, Rishabh to take charge of Indian team in post-Rohit eraShubman Gill is expected to take over as India captain following Rohit Sharma's retirement. The BCCI has also earmarked Rishabh Pant for the vice-captain's role in the Test team.

Virat Kohli, you have so much left: Ambati Rayudu amidst retirement rumoursAmbati Rayudu has appealed to Virat Kohli not to retire from Test cricket. The request comes amidst rumours following Rohit Sharma's retirement which signals a potential shift in India's Test team lineup.

Iga Swiatek makes shock exit, set for huge drop in rankingsItalian Open 2025: Defending champion Iga Swiatek crashed out after losing in straight sets to Danielle Collins of the USA in the Round of 32 clash on May 10.

IPL 2025: Foreign players fly out of India suspension of tournamentThe Indian Premier League have sent their foreign players back home amid India-Pakistan border tensions. Players left for their homes via different locations.

Barcelona vs Real Madrid: Latest live streaming detailsBarcelona and Real Madrid will meet in a decisive LaLiga clash on May 11. The shift in streaming rights to FanCode has sparked debate amongst Indian football fans.

Can India avenge the Asia Cup heartbreak against Sri Lanka in grand finale?Harmanpreet Kaur's India and Chamari Athapaththu's Sri Lanka will face each other in the summit clash of the tri-nation series on Sunday, May 11 at the R Premadasa Stadium in Colombo.

From Dhoni to Rohit: Indian stars BGT forced to retireIndia captain Rohit Sharma called time on his Test career ahead India's tour of England. Rohit was amongst the long list of Indian cricketers who called time on their careers after playing against Australia.

RCB players safely reach Bengaluru amid India-Pakistan tensionsIPL 2025: Royal Challengers Bengaluru players and other personnel reached Bengaluru on Saturday as the BCCI took the call of suspending the IPL for seven days.

UAE retire out entire team in Women's T20 World Cup QualifiersUAE beat Qatar by 163 runs in the Women's T20 World Cup Asia Qualifiers 2025 after skipper Esha Rohit Oza scored a hundred and picked up a wicket at the Terdthai Cricket Ground in Bangkok.

Anahat, Abhay make winning starts at Squash World ChampionshipYoung Indian squash stars Anahat Singh and Abhay Singh secured victories in their opening matches at the World Championship. Their wins set up challenging next rounds against higher-ranked Egyptian players, promising intense competition ahead.

Arsenal agree Martin Zubimendi deal with Real Sociedad: ReportsArsenal have reportedly won the race to sign Martin Zubimendi, agreeing to meet his 50 million pounds release clause and securing a verbal agreement with the Spanish midfielder, who is expected to become their first signing of the 2025 summer window.

Ukraine's Kostyuk shakes hands with Kasatkina, praises anti-war stanceUkrainian tennis player Marta Kostyuk, known for her outspoken stance against Russia's invasion of Ukraine and her refusal to shake hands with Russian or Belarusian opponents, offered a handshake to Daria Kasatkina after defeating her 6-4, 6-2 in the second round of the Italian Open.

India men's compound team wins gold at Archery World Cup Stage 2India's compound men's team won gold, the women's team bagged silver, and the mixed team claimed bronze at the Archery World Cup Stage 2 in Shanghai—marking a successful outing and continuing their impressive form ahead of future international events.

Mohammed Afsal breaks 800m national record in UAE Athletics Grand PrixIndia's Mohammed Afsal set a new national record in the men's 800m race at the UAE Athletics Grand Prix 2025 in Dubai, clocking 1:45.61.

Confused Rishabh Pant has forgotten his best game: Sanjay BangarLucknow Super Giants captain Rishabh Pant is confused and has forgotten to play his best shots, feels former India batting coach Sanjay Bangar. Bangar has urged Pant to play more straight-batted shots in limited-overs cricket.

BCCI, please convince him to stay: Fans on Kohli's Test retirement indicationThe fans have urged the BCCI to step in and convince Virat Kohli to reconsider his decision to retire from Test cricket. Ahead of the upcoming tour of England, Kohli has reportedly informed the BCCI about his intention to step away from the longest format of the game.

Bumrah should replace Rohit Sharma as India's Test captain: Madan LalMadan Lal suggested Jasprit Bumrah should replace Rohit Sharma as Test captain, given his leadership success and strong performance during India's recent series against Australia.

Rohit Sharma's Test retirement didn't come as a surprise: Michael AthertonMichael Atherton has claimed that Rohit Sharma's Test retirement didn't come as a surprise as the 38-year-old's form was dwindling and India weren't performing well under his captaincy.

Virat Kohli informs BCCI he wants to retire from Tests before England tour: SourcesA top BCCI official has urged Virat Kohli to reconsider his decision after the former captain informed the board of his willingness to retire from Test cricket. India are set to tour England for a five-Test series, starting on June 20.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
